metadata.title: CVE-2021-3468 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in avahi in versions 0.6 up to 0.8. The event used to signal the termination of the client connection on the avahi Unix socket is not correctly handled in the client_work function, allowing a local attacker to trigger an infinite loop. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to the availability of the avahi service, which becomes unresponsive after this flaw is triggered.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-3468` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

avahi-autoipd - 0.8-5ubuntu3
avahi-daemon - 0.8-5ubuntu3
avahi-discover - 0.8-5ubuntu3
avahi-dnsconfd - 0.8-5ubuntu3
avahi-ui-utils - 0.8-5ubuntu3
avahi-utils - 0.8-5ubuntu3
gir1.2-avahi-0.6 - 0.8-5ubuntu3
libavahi-client3 - 0.8-5ubuntu3
libavahi-common-data - 0.8-5ubuntu3
libavahi-common3 - 0.8-5ubuntu3
libavahi-compat-libdnssd1 - 0.8-5ubuntu3
libavahi-core7 - 0.8-5ubuntu3
libavahi-glib1 - 0.8-5ubuntu3
libavahi-gobject0 - 0.8-5ubuntu3
libavahi-ui-gtk3-0 - 0.8-5ubuntu3
python3-avahi - 0.8-5ubuntu3
No subscription required

notes.note: mdeslaur> as of 2021-07-06, the proposed patch has not been commited upstream

criterions.comment: avahi package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.8-5ubuntu3').
